user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of send_redirect_fixed_rq_target:
```c
static void
send_redirect_fixed_rq_target (struct MHD_Connection *c)
{
  char *b;
  size_t fixed_uri_len;
  size_t i;
  size_t o;
  char *hdr_name;
  size_t hdr_name_len;

  mhd_assert (MHD_CONNECTION_REQ_LINE_RECEIVING == c->state);
  mhd_assert (0 != c->rq.hdrs.rq_line.num_ws_in_uri);
  mhd_assert (c->rq.hdrs.rq_line.num_ws_in_uri <= \
              c->rq.req_target_len);
  fixed_uri_len = c->rq.req_target_len
                  + 2 * c->rq.hdrs.rq_line.num_ws_in_uri;
  if ( (fixed_uri_len + 200 > c->daemon->pool_size) ||
       (fixed_uri_len > MHD_MAX_FIXED_URI_LEN) ||
       (NULL == (b = malloc (fixed_uri_len + 1))) )
  {
    connection_close_error (c,
                            _ ("The request has whitespace character is " \
                               "in the URI and the URI is too large to " \
                               "send automatic redirect to fixed URI.\n"));
    return;
  }
  i = 0;
  o = 0;

  do
  {
    const char chr = c->rq.hdrs.rq_line.rq_tgt[i++];

    mhd_assert ('\r' != chr); /* Replaced during request line parsing */
    mhd_assert ('\n' != chr); /* Rejected during request line parsing */
    mhd_assert (0 != chr); /* Rejected during request line parsing */
    switch (chr)
    {
    case ' ':
      b[o++] = '%';
      b[o++] = '2';
      b[o++] = '0';
      break;
    case '\t':
      b[o++] = '%';
      b[o++] = '0';
      b[o++] = '9';
      break;
    case 0x0B:   /* VT (vertical tab) */
      b[o++] = '%';
      b[o++] = '0';
      b[o++] = 'B';
      break;
    case 0x0C:   /* FF (form feed) */
      b[o++] = '%';
      b[o++] = '0';
      b[o++] = 'C';
      break;
    default:
      b[o++] = chr;
      break;
    }
  } while (i < c->rq.req_target_len);
  mhd_assert (fixed_uri_len == o);
  b[o] = 0; /* Zero-terminate the result */

  hdr_name_len = MHD_STATICSTR_LEN_ (MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION);
  hdr_name = malloc (hdr_name_len + 1);
  if (NULL != hdr_name)
  {
    memcpy (hdr_name,
            MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION,
            hdr_name_len + 1);
    /* hdr_name and b are free()d within this call */
    transmit_error_response_header (c,
                                    MHD_HTTP_MOVED_PERMANENTLY,
                                    RQ_TARGET_INVALID_CHAR,
                                    hdr_name,
                                    hdr_name_len,
                                    b,
                                    o);
    return;
  }
  free (b);
  connection_close_error (c,
                          _ ("The request has whitespace character is in the " \
                             "URI.\n"));
  return;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function send_redirect_fixed_rq_target:
static void
connection_close_error (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                        const char *emsg)
{
  connection->stop_with_error = true;
  connection->discard_request = true;
#ifdef HAVE_MESSAGES
  if (NULL != emsg)
    MHD_DLOG (connection->daemon,
              "%s\n",
              emsg);
#else  /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  (void) emsg; /* Mute compiler warning. */
#endif /* ! HAVE_MESSAGES */
  MHD_connection_close_ (connection,
                         MHD_REQUEST_TERMINATED_WITH_ERROR);
}
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
memcpy (hdr_name,
            MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION,
            hdr_name_len + 1);
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 8.13 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: The memcpy uses MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION as the source. If MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION is a string literal or a static array of characters (e.g. "Location" or static const char[]), then there is no pointer declaration here that ought to be const and Rule 8.13 is not violated. However, if MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION is declared elsewhere as a non-const pointer (e.g. char *MHD_HTTP_HEADER_LOCATION), then that declaration would violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 and should be changed to point to a const-qualified type (const char * or static const char[]).
